comments:
Below is the actual bug that i believe exists inside the Java plugin window 
2000 version.  I created a hello world project and then a class to see how 
things are compiled inside the plugin.  (based on the steps described on the 
faq:http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/faq/eclipse-faq.html#users_5) the faq number 
is 6.  once i try to run the program, it throughs an exception and says that 
"Exception occured during Launch"
"Reason : Exception occured executing command line"

After that i look at the .log file to trace the problem and found that the 
string or the path to the source file has some how been corrupted as can be 
seen by the error given below. the path comtains quotes " ", in the middle of 
the path which i believe is causing the problem.  And  i didnt find a way to 
remove those quotes through the preference diaglog. So i basically could not 
compile my code with the compiler.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.core 4 120 Feb 04, 2003 18:21:45.680
!MESSAGE Exception occurred executing command line.
!STACK 0
java.io.IOException: CreateProcess: 
C:\Program" "Files\eclipse\workspace\HelloWorld\HelloWorld.java 
C:/Program" "Files/eclipse/workspace/HelloWorld/HelloWorld.java error=123
	at java.lang.Win32Process.create(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Win32Process.<init>(Win32Process.java:72)
	at java.lang.Runtime.execInternal(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:551)
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin.exec(DebugPlugin.java:489)
	at 
org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.internal.program.launchConfigurations.ProgramLaunch
Delegate.launch(ProgramLaunchDelegate.java:93)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:147)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.LaunchConfigurationsDialog$6.
run(LaunchConfigurationsDialog.java:1241)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:95)

Your description says you are creating a simple HelloWorld program and running 
it, but the stack trace contains a reference to the 'external tools' launch 
delegate, which implies something else is going on.  Can you reproduce this 
problem?  If so, can you post a list of detailed steps to reproduce?  Also, what 
version of Eclipse, and what VM are you using?  Thanks.

It looks like you're trying to launch a Java application using the external
tools support for launching programs. You should launch Java applications
using a "Java Application" launch configuration (available from the Run or
Debug menus in the Java perspective).

If you configure it correctly, you should still be able to use a "Program"
configuration to launch java, though. Can you provide the details of the
launch config you're using? What are the values of the fields on the "Main"
tab?

From an email from infoapex1@netscape.com:




Hi


All i was trying to do was compile the basic hello world program according to 
the FAQ on your web site(eclipse.org).  i think it was FAQ # 6.


I know what the problem is and was able to compile the code.


The problem is with the fact that the tool which takes care of gathering paths 
to the jdk and the source code does not recognize blank spaces in path   like 
how the Windows operating system allows you to create or insert a blank space 
inside your path eg.


"c:\Program Files"




the tool does not recognize the blank space between the Program and Files as 
shown above which basically screwed up everything for me.


I had installed the jdk inside the above mentioned directory and also the 
eclipse IDE.


The work-around for this problem was to install both the jdk and eclipse in the 
root directory.  "c:\".


this basically cleared the problem.


let me know if you need further clarification on this matter.  I feel this still 
a bug cuz most people on windows would be by default, would be installing the 
software in the program files directory.


Thanks

The real question here is how, if you were following the steps in the tutorial, 
you wound up with 'external tools' in the walkback.  If you can duplicate this 
problem, a detailed step-by-step set of instructions on how to reproduce the 
problem would be greatly appreciated.  Thanks.

I have not been able to reproduce this problem - both using external tools and 
java application launch configurations, using the "JRE" from "C:\Program 
Files\Java\...".
